text.p: These are the leading stories in the Belgrade press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified them and does not vouch for their accuracy.
POLITIKA
- Cypriot Foreign Minister Alecos Michaeleides arrives on a two-day official visit to Yugoslavia.
- Serbian opposition leaders visit the European Parliament in Brussels.
- World Bank and IMF approve $60 million loan to Bosnian Serb Republic.
- Germany's Siemens discusses with Serbian energy and mining minister Dragan Kostic cooperation in the revitalisation of Serbia's energy and mining facilities.
- Germany's Berliner bank and Komercijalna banka a.d. of Belgrade signed a cooperation agreement and agree a 10-million German mark credit line.
- Serbian taxi drivers on strike on Wednesday over high taxes.
NASA BORBA
- Russia is ready to participate in reconstruction of energy facilities in Yugoslavia, says Russian Deputy Prime Minister and Trade Minister Oleg Davidov.
- Momcilo Krajisnik, member of the Bosnian Presidency, says Serb deputies are ready to sign text of official statement in the Bosnian House of Representatives.

- Opposition Serbian Renewal Movement (SPO) point to extremely high costs of advertising on Radio Televison Serbia -- one second costs 2,000 dinars and ten seconds 4,000 -- and says it will opt for door-to-door election campaigning.
- Polish economic exhibition opens in Belgrade fair grouping some 100 exhibitors.
VECERNJE NOVOSTI
- Germany and Yugoslavia sign declaration on mutual protection of investments.
- The federal government has prepared a platform for normalising relations with Slovenia which could be a step to opening of embassies of the two countries in Belgrade and Ljubljana.
- Yugoslav total exports to reach around $2.5 billion by the end of the year, says the federal statistics office.
- Her Royal Highness Princess Anne visits British troops in Bosnia.
- Airshow Beograd 96 will be held on Saturday, October 12.
BORBA
- Federal government adopts basis for normalisation of relations between Yugoslavia and Bosnia agreed at the meeting in Paris last week.
POLITIKA EKSPRES
- Autumn fashion fair opens in Belgrade.
- Private entrepreneurship minister Radoje Djukic supports striking taxi drivers.
-- Belgrade newsroom, +381 11 222 43 05
